title: Arthur Eddington
summary: Sir Arthur Stanley Eddington OM FRS[2] (28 December 1882 â€“ 22 November 1944) was an English astronomer, physicist, and mathematician. He was also a philosopher of science and a populariser of science. The Eddington limit, the natural limit to the luminosity of stars, or the radiation generated by accretion onto a compact object, is named in his honour.
